de.jannlab.core

Class NetBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.jannlab.core.NetBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Net, Serializable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FeedForwardNetBase, RecurrentNetBase

    public abstract class NetBase
extends Object
implements Net, Serializable, Cloneable
    This class is an abstract base-class for all different implementations in this framework. It contains general methods, which are equal for different network types. The aim is to reduce the amount of code each special network implementation needs. Such general methods are input, output and buffering mechanisms, computing a layer integration or activation (or the gradient) for one time step, computing the error and some other data- and meta-methods.

    Author:
    Sebastian Otte
    See Also:
    Net, Serialized Form

        protected int frameidx
        Gives the current frameidx of the network. This can be considered as an inner state during the computation process.

    • Method Detail

      • computeLayerActivations

        protected void computeLayerActivations(int idx)
        This methods computes the activation (also integration) of a single layer given by idx, based on the current frameidx. The method ensures that the activations of all arrays of the layer are computed in correct time order, which has been defined during generating the network.

        Parameters:
        idx - Gives a layer index.

      • computeLayerGradients

        protected void computeLayerGradients(int idx)
        This methods computes the gradient (reverse integration and derivative activation)for a single layer given by idx, based on the current frameidx. The method ensures that gradient of the arrays of the layer are computed in correct (reverse) time order, which has been defined during generating the network.

        Parameters:
        idx - Gives a layer index.

      • sharedCopy

        public Net sharedCopy()
        Performs a shared copy of the network instance. Some data part such a links, weights etc. are shared. The rest (data buffers) are private. The shared copy provides parallel computation with the "same" network.
        Specified by:
        sharedCopy in interface Net
        Returns:
        Shared copy of this instance.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the network, which means that all inner states (activations, derivations) are set to 0.0. The method also resets the time index which is 0 after doing reset.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface Net
